title: Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site: Field Trips
body: Field Trips       Results   Showing results 1-2 of 2    Sort By:  Title Date         Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site Experience Grant-Kohrs Ranch    Bring your students to Grant-Kohrs Ranch for a unique educational experience.  Park Rangers may be able to offer free programs for school groups on a variety of topics from the Open Range Cowboy to a GPS Scavenger Hunt.     Type:Field Trips Grade level:Pre-Kindergarten-College Undergraduate Level Subjects:Agriculture, American Indian History and Culture, Biology: Animals, Biology: Plants, Climate, Climate Change, Conservation, Education, Environment, Geography, Historic Preservation, History, Pioneer America, Regional Studies, Social Studies, Westward Expansion National/State Standards:National U.S. History Standards Era 4 Standards1A, 1B, 1C, 2A, 2B, 2E, Era 6 Standard 1C, 1D, 2CMontana State Social Studies Content Standards 3, 4, 5, 6        Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site Horsin' Around: Online Pre-visit Activity   Through this online pre-visit activity, students will learn about different breeds of horses. Then they will create a PowerPoint presentation that provides information about a breed of horse. The class will then take a field trip to the Grant-Kohrs Ranch NHS or other type of ranch to interact with and see different breeds of horses.    Type:Field Trips Grade level:Upper Elementary: Third Grade through Fifth Grade Subjects:Literacy and Language Arts
